title: STRING_TO_URL Function
description:
STRING_TO_URL split a URL ( Uniform Resource Locator ) into its comï¿¾ponents and stores it in the data type URL. If in STR no path or protocoll is

specifed, so the function sets the missing values automatically with the

specifed replacement values. 

A URL is as follows:

Protocol : / / user : Password @ domain : port / path ? query # anchor
name: STRING_TO_URL

input.name: STR
input.description: The input URL string that is to be split into its components.

input.name: DEFAULT_PROTOCOL
input.description: The replacement protocol to use if none is specified in the input URL.

input.name: DEFAULT_PATH
input.description: The alternate path to use if none is specified in the input URL.

output.name: URL
output.description: The data type that holds the components of the split URL.

return_value.description: The resulting split components of the URL.

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: The protocol used in the URL.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user name component of the URL, if specified.

fields.name: password
fields.description: The password component of the URL, if specified.

fields.name: domain
fields.description: The domain name of the URL.

fields.name: port
fields.description: The port number specified in the URL, if any.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path component of the URL.

fields.name: query
fields.description: The query component of the URL, if any.

fields.name: anchor
fields.description: The anchor component of the URL, if any.
